summary: The EPA regulates certain facilities that make, use, or store hazardous chemicals. These facilities are required to have risk management programs to prevent and prepare for accidental releases of these chemicals. Federal data indicates about 31% of these facilities are located in areas with certain natural hazards—like wildfires and storm surges—that may be worsened by climate change. title: Chemical Accident Prevention: EPA Should Ensure Regulated Facilities Consider Risks from Climate Change
